keyTakeAways: A former New York state prison guard, Robert Brooks, died from injuries sustained during a violent beating by correctional officers at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024.
The body-camera footage, which was silent but clearly showed guards assaulting Brooks, became central evidence in the trial and sparked public outrage over prison abuse and institutional neglect.

David Kingsley was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter, while Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges, though Kieffer faced a false instrument charge and Galliher and Kieffer were acquitted of second-degree gang assault.
Prosecutors argued that all guards acted as a gang and showed a depraved indifference to human life, asserting that collective responsibility applies in the case.
William Fitzpatrick, the special prosecutor, took over the case after Attorney General Letitia James recused herself due to representing guards in civil lawsuits.
This case is part of a broader pattern of violence in New York prisons, with similar charges pending in the death of inmate Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility in March 2025.
Six of the 10 guards indicted in February faced charges, with five previously pleading guilty to manslaughter and one to a misdemeanor charge of attempted tampering with evidence.
Three more guards have agreed to plead guilty to reduced charges and are cooperating with prosecutors, including two who testified at the trial.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A former New York state prison guard, Robert Brooks, died from injuries sustained during a brutal beating at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024, captured on silent body-camera footage that revealed guards punching, stomping, and lifting him by the neck. The footage, which showed the guards acting unconcerned, became central to the prosecution's case. David Kingsley was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter, while Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges. Kieffer faced a false instrument charge, and both Galliher and Kieffer were acquitted of gang assault charges. Prosecutors argued that all guards acted as a gang with a depraved indifference to life, while defense attorneys claimed that individual actions did not equate to criminal guilt. The case is part of a broader pattern of violence in New York prisons, with similar charges pending in the March 2025 death of inmate Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility. William Fitzpatrick, the special prosecutor, took over the case after Attorney General Letitia James recused herself due to representing guards in civil lawsuits. Six of the 10 guards indicted in February have either pleaded guilty or been found guilty, with three more agreeing to reduced charges and cooperating with prosecutors.
title: Former New York state prison guard found guilty in death of inmate beaten, 2 others acquitted
